gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2
Class Uri

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2.Uri

public final class Uri
extends Object

A immutable representation of a URI, with a namespace part and an optional local name.

Author:
Andreou Dimitris, email: jim.andreou (at) gmail (dot) com, Vouzoukidou Nelly, email: vuzukid (at) csd (dot) uoc (dot) gr

Nested Class Summary
static class Uri.Delimiter
          An enumeration of the options of including or not the delimiter of the namespace and local part of a Uri in the textual representation when it has an empty local part.
static class Uri.UriFormatException
          An exceptio thrown when a string cannot be parsed to a Uri.

Constructor Detail

Uri

public Uri(String namespace,
           String localName)
    throws Uri.UriFormatException
Creates a Uri instance with the specified namespace and local name.

Parameters:
namespace - the namespace of the created Uri
localName - the localName of the created Uri
Throws:
Uri.UriFormatException - if the namespace part contains a hash (#) symbol in any place except its last character, or if the local name part contains a hash (#) symbol in any place except its first character
Method Detail

parse

public static Uri parse(String uri)
                 throws Uri.UriFormatException
Parses the textual representation of a URI and creates a Uri instance for it.

The expected form of a URI is:
namespacePart[#localNamePart]
or
namespacePart[/localNamePart]
or
namespacePart[:localNamePart]
where namespacePart and localNamePart consist of any character apart from "#".

Parameters:
uri - the textual representation of a URI to parse
Returns:
a Uri instance that represents the specified URI, guaranteed to be non-null
Throws:
Uri.UriFormatException - if the specified URI cannot be parsed

tryParse

public static Uri tryParse(String uri)
Parses the textual representation of a URI if possible and creates a Uri instance for it, or returns null if the URI cannot be parsed.

See parse(String) for a description of the expected textual form of a URI to be parsed.

Parameters:
uri - the textual representation of a URI to parse
Returns:
a Uri instance that represents the specified URI, or null if the URI cannot be parsed

getNamespace

public String getNamespace()
Returns the namespace of this Uri. Note that the namespace does not end with a hash (#) symbol.

Returns:
the namespace part of this Uri

getNamespaceUri

public Uri getNamespaceUri()
Returns the namespace of this Uri, as a Uri object itself.

Returns:
the namespace part of this Uri

appendNamespace

public void appendNamespace(Appendable appendable)
Appends the namespace of this Uri to the specified appendable.

Parameters:
appendable - the appendable on which to append the namespace part
Throws:
NullPointerException - if appendable is null
RuntimeException - if an IOException occurs (the thrown exception will enclose the IOException)

getLocalName

public String getLocalName()
Returns the local name of this Uri. Note that the local name does not start with a hash (#) symbol.

Returns:
the namespace part of this Uri

Parameters:
appendable - the appendable on which to append the namespace part
Throws:
NullPointerException - if appendable is null
RuntimeException - if an IOException occurs (the thrown exception will enclose the IOException)

Returns whether this.getNamespace().equals(uri.getNamespace()).

Parameters:

Returns:
whether this.getNamespace().equals(uri.getNamespace())
Throws:
NullPointerException - if uri is null

Returns whether this.getLocalName().equals(uri.getLocalName()).

Parameters:

Returns:
whether this.getLocalName().equals(uri.getLocalName())
Throws:
NullPointerException - if uri is null

isValid

public boolean isValid()
Returns whether this URI is valid or not.

A URI is valid if it does not violate RFC 2396, as argumented by the deviations in URI.

Returns:
true if this URI is valid; false otherwise.

isAbsolute

public boolean isAbsolute()
Returns whether this URI is absolute or not.

A URI is absolute when it has a scheme component, as defined in RFC 2396

Returns:
true if this URI is absolute; false otherwise.

equals

public boolean equals(Object obj)
Returns whether the specified object is a Uri instance with equal namespace and local part as this Uri.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Parameters:
obj -
Returns:
whether the specified object is a Uri instance with equal namespace and local part as this Uri.

validateCharacters

public boolean validateCharacters()
Returns:
true if and only if this Uri contains only valid characters
See Also:

toString

public String toString()

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:

toString

public String toString(Uri.Delimiter delimiter)
Returns a textual representation of this Uri, with an optional delimiter symbol if the local name is empty and delimiter == Delimiter.WITH. If the local name is not empty, the delimiter is always included, separating the namespace and the local name.

Parameters:
hash - Hash.WITH to append a hash; Hash.WITHOUT otherwise
Returns:
the textual representation of this Uri

toString

public void toString(Appendable appendable)
Appends a textual representation of this Uri to the specified Appendable, without a hash (#) symbol if the local name is empty. If the local name is not empty, the hash is always included, separating the namespace and the local name.

Equivalent to toString(appendable, Hash.WITHOUT.

Parameters:
appendable - the appendable where to append the textual representation of this Uri

toString

public void toString(Appendable appendable,
                     Uri.Delimiter delimiter)
Appends a textual representation of this Uri to the specified Appendable, with an optional hash (#) symbol if the local name is empty and hash == Hash.WITHOUT. If the local name is not empty, the hash is always included, separating the namespace and the local name.

Parameters:
appendable - the appendable where to append the textual representation of this Uri
hash - Hash.WITH to append a hash; Hash.WITHOUT otherwise

withLocalName

public Uri withLocalName(String localName)
Returns a Uri that has the same namespace as this Uri, and the specifed local name.

Note that Uri is immutable, i.e. its namespace and local name cannot change.

Parameters:
localName - the local name of the created Uri
Returns:
a Uri that has the same namespace as this Uri, and the specifed local name

withNamespace

public Uri withNamespace(String namespace)
Returns a Uri that has the same local name as this Uri, and the specifed namespace.

Note that Uri is immutable, i.e. its namespace and local name cannot change.

Parameters:
namespace - the namespace of the created Uri
Returns:
a Uri that has the same local name as this Uri, and the specifed namespace
